page.title: 14St. Giles' Cathedral
page.content: The crown spire of St.Giles is, after the Castle, probably the most famous landmark of Edinburgh's Old Town. St. Giles' may claim to be the centre of Scottish national life, for it is the 'High Kirk' (main church) of our capital city. Here the great services of the Scottish nation take place. When she stays at Holyrood, the Queen attends the services here. Over 1000 years St. Giles' has seen many developments in religion and many historical events. Inside are memorials to outstanding Scots of the past. Recently a central sanctuary has been made so that the people can meet around the Communion Table. A modern stained glass window, depicting the life of the poet Robert Burns, has just replaced an outworn one above the east door.
